caption: This photograph features an elderly bald man wearing glasses, dressed in a light-colored short-sleeve shirt and dark trousers. He is seated on a rock at the edge of a scenic overlook, his body turned slightly towards the camera and his hands folded in his lap. The setting is a rugged, natural landscape characterized by exposed rocky surfaces and a lush forested area that deeply fills the background. Adjacent to the man, on the right side of the image, stands a gnarled, twisted tree adding a dramatic touch to the composition. The tree appears weathered, exhibiting bare branches intertwined with a few leaves, indicating resilience in a possibly harsh environment. Behind and beneath the area where the man sits, the terrain abruptly descends into a densely wooded valley, which suggests a high vantage point overlooking a deep forest area. The lighting in the photograph suggests it is taken during the day with natural light casting soft shadows and illuminating the scene, enhancing the tranquil yet rugged beauty of the environment.
title: Mr. G. T. Richards, editor-publisher of the Camdenton Reveille, poses on the Bluff overlooking the waters of Gunter's Big Spring. The water is impounded in a trough between high ridges in the Ha Ha Tonka area, forming a crystal-clear lake.
placename: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park (Mo.)
location: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park, Missouri
